snippet: Beginning next season, new rules will allow men, women and pairs skaters to use music with lyrics in their programs. But some wonder whether the innovation will harm the sport’s credibility.
abstract: International Skating Union will begin allowing men, women and pairs skaters to use music with lyrics during their performances starting in 2015 season; change is intended to attract a younger audience to figure skating, though some worry that it will alienate traditional fans and harm sport's credibility.
lead_paragraph: Beginning next season, new rules will allow men, women and pairs skaters to use music with lyrics in their programs. But some wonder whether the innovation will harm the sport’s credibility.

headline.main: ‘Rhapsody in Blue’ or Rap? Skating Will Add Vocals
headline.print_headline: ‘Rhapsody in Blue’ or Rap? Skating Will Add Vocals
